### **Sprint Metrics**

#### **Definition of Ready**

- [ ] Business requirements documented
- [ ] Technical specification reviewed
- [ ] Acceptance criteria defined
- [ ] Dependencies identified
- [ ] Story points estimated
- [ ] No outstanding questions

#### **Definition of Done**

- [ ] Code written and reviewed
- [ ] Unit tests written and passing
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] Performance requirements met
- [ ] Deployed to staging
- [ ] Acceptance criteria verified

### **Risk Assessment**

#### **High Risk Items**

| Risk                      | Probability | Impact | Mitigation Plan                              |
| ------------------------- | ----------- | ------ | -------------------------------------------- |
| Database schema changes   | Medium      | High   | Backup strategy, gradual rollout             |
| External API dependencies | Low         | Medium | Circuit breaker pattern, fallback mechanisms |
| Security vulnerabilities  | Low         | High   | Regular security audits, automated scanning  |

#### **Dependencies**

| Dependency                 | Owner               | Status         | Impact if Delayed |
| -------------------------- | ------------------- | -------------- | ----------------- |
| Third-party API access     | @brendadeeznuts1111 | ‚úÖ Ready       | Low               |
| Database migration scripts | @nolarose1968-pixel | ‚úÖ Ready       | Medium            |
| Security audit tools       | @brendadeeznuts1111 | ‚ö†Ô∏è In Progress | Medium            |

### **Daily Standup Format**

#### **What did you accomplish yesterday?**

- [Team member responses]

#### **What will you work on today?**

- [Team member responses]

#### **Are there any blockers?**

- [Team member responses]

### **Sprint Burndown**

```
Sprint Progress Tracking
========================
Day 1: [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] (8 points remaining)
Day 2: [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] (8 points remaining)
Day 3: [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] (8 points remaining)
Day 4: [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] (8 points remaining)
Day 5: [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] (8 points remaining)

Legend: [ ] = Not started, [/] = In progress, [X] = Completed
```

### **Success Criteria**

#### **Sprint Goals Achievement**

- [ ] All high-priority items completed (80% completion target)
- [ ] Sprint velocity maintained or improved
- [ ] No critical bugs introduced
- [ ] All acceptance criteria met

#### **Quality Metrics**

- [ ] Code coverage ‚â• 80%
- [ ] Zero critical security issues
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Documentation updated

### **Communication Plan**

#### **Daily Updates**

- **Time:** 9:00 AM daily
- **Format:** Slack/Teams standup
- **Duration:** 15 minutes
- **Attendees:** All sprint team members

#### **Sprint Reviews**

- **Day 4:** Mid-sprint review
- **Day 5:** Sprint completion review
- **Audience:** Product owner, stakeholders
- **Format:** Demo + metrics review

#### **Sprint Planning**

- **Next Sprint:** [Date and time]
- **Preparation:** Backlog refinement completed
- **Duration:** 2 hours

---

## üéØ **Sprint Execution Checklist**

### **Day 1: Sprint Start**

- [ ] Sprint planning meeting completed
- [ ] Sprint backlog finalized
- [ ] Team capacity confirmed
- [ ] Daily standup established
- [ ] Development environment ready

### **Daily Execution**

- [ ] Standup completed
- [ ] Progress tracked
- [ ] Blockers identified and resolved
- [ ] Quality standards maintained

### **Day 5: Sprint End**

- [ ] All stories completed or carried over
- [ ] Sprint review conducted
- [ ] Sprint retrospective completed
- [ ] Next sprint planned
- [ ] Metrics analyzed and recorded

- **Sprint Progress:** [Current]/[Target] story points
- **Burndown Chart:** [Link to chart]
- **Quality Metrics:** Code coverage, test pass rate
- **Velocity Trend:** Previous 3 sprints comparison

### **Team Health**

- **Morale:** [High/Medium/Low]
- **Collaboration:** [Rating 1-5]
- **Workload Balance:** [Even/Uneven]
- **Blocker Resolution:** [Average time to resolve]
